sentences: They released their first EP entitled Once Again in 1996 and concentrated on live performances.
In 1997 after a disagreement with bandmates and his mother's illness Gaffney left and was replaced by Jeremy.
In 2005, Hoods were dropped from Victory Records after a dispute over royalties and management.
They signed with Eulogy Recordings in 2005 and released The King Is Dead.
The group released a new album, Ghetto Blaster, on April 24, 2007.
The release Pit Beast dropped in May 2009 after the band signed with I Scream Records.
In 2014 the band signed with Artery Recordings and released "Gato Negro".
